intro: Myristica celebica, commonly known as the nutmeg tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Maluku Islands of Indonesia. It belongs to the Myristicaceae family and is closely related to the nutmeg tree (Myristica fragrans). The plant produces a valuable seed known as mace, which is used as a spice and medicinal ingredient. Its flowers are typically yellow or green, and the tree can grow up to 20 meters tall. The botanical features of Myristica celebica make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
